newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia says China palm oil import quota approved.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia says China palm oil import quota approved.

text.p: China has approved imports of 1.3 million tonnes of palm oil between August 1996 and March 1997, Malaysian Primary Industries Minister Lim Keng Yaik said on Thursday .
The national Bernama news agency quoted the minister as saying that he received the news from Chinese authorities two days ago.
Lim said he believed 80 percent of China's imports would come from Malaysia, the world's largest exporter, and the remainder from Indonesia.
Lim had recently requested the Chinese government to announce its import quota to enable local refiners to make plans for the export markets.
He had also asked for a quota that would be viable for Malaysian refiners operating in China. There are 17 palm oil refineries in China set up by Malaysians in joint venture with Chinese partners.
Lim said the import duty for crude palm oil and palm oil products into China would be maintained at 18 percent.
